member.name: T:Microsoft.IE.Manager
member.summary: Provides methods for enabling managed code to execute as an ActiveX control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.AreOnTheSameSite(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the site portion of two URLs have the same canonicalized values.
member.returns: true if the two URLs are on the same site; otherwise, false.
member.param: The first URL to compare.
The second URL to compare.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.AreTheSame(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether two URLs are the same in their canonicalized forms.
member.returns: true if the two URLs are the same; otherwise, false.
member.param: The first URL to compare.
The second URL to compare.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.CanonizeURL(System.String,Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS)
member.summary: Converts a URL string into canonical form.
member.param: A null-terminated string of maximum length () that contains a URL string. If the string does not refer to a file, it must include a valid scheme such as "http://".

The flags that specify how the URL will be converted to canonical form. The following flags can be combined:
Treat "/./" and "/../" in a URL string as literal characters, not as shorthand for navigation.
Convert any occurrence of "%" to its escape sequence.
Replace only spaces with escape sequences. This flag takes precedence over , but does not apply to opaque URLs.
Replace unsafe characters with their escape sequences. Unsafe characters are characters that may be altered during transport across the Internet. They include the <, >, ", #, {, }, |, \, ^, [, ], and ' characters. This flag applies to all URLs, including opaque URLs.
Defined to be the same as .
Combine URLs with client-defined pluggable protocols, according to the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification. This flag does not apply to standard protocols such as FTP, HTTP, and Gopher. If this flag is set, there is no need to also set .
Unescape any escape sequences that the URLs contain, with two exceptions. The escape sequences for "?" and "#" are not unescaped. If one of the URL_ESCAPE flags is also set, the two URLs are first unescaped, and then combined, and then escaped.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.DecodeDomainId(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a byte array that contains the integer representation of the passed-in hexadecimal string.
member.returns: An array that contains the integer representation of .
member.param: A hexadecimal string that represents a domain identity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.GetClassFactory(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Not implemented.
member.param: The name of the assembly.
The name of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.GetCodeBase(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the code base and the application name from the passed-in URL string.
member.returns: true if the code base was found; otherwise, false.
member.param: The URL for the code base.
When this method returns, contains the path to the code base.
When this method returns, contains the application name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.GetConfigurationFile(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the path and file name of the configuration file from the passed-in URL string.
member.returns: true if the configuration file was found; otherwise, false.
member.param: The URL for the configuration file.
When this method returns, contains the path of the configuration file.
When this method returns, contains the name of the configuration file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.GetSecuredClassFactory(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a class factory that provides security information about the assembly.
member.returns: An object that represents the secure class factory.
member.param: One of the following CORIESECURITY values: CORIESECURITY_ZONE: 0x01 CORIESECURITY_SITE: 0x02
One of the following URLZONE values: URLZONE_LOCAL_MACHINE: 0x00 URLZONE_INTRANET: 0x01 URLZONE_TRUSTED: 0x02 URLZONE_INTERNET: 0x03 URLZONE_UNTRUSTED: 0x04
The site address.
A unique ID for the site.
The hexadecimal encoded hash value of the assembly that is being loaded.
The name of the assembly.
The name of the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.GetSiteName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the site name for the specified URL.
member.returns: The site name for the specified URL.
member.param: The target URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.INTERNET_MAX_PATH_LENGTH
member.summary: Gets the maximum length of a string that represents an Internet path.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.INTERNET_MAX_SCHEME_LENGTH
member.summary: Gets the maximum length of a string that represents an Internet scheme.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.INTERNET_MAX_URL_LENGTH
member.summary: Gets the maximum length of a string that represents a URL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.IsValidURL(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified URL is valid.
member.returns: true if the URL is valid; otherwise, false.
member.param: The URL to be checked.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.MakeFullLink(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a full URL for the passed-in link, code base, and application.
member.returns: A full link to the specified application.
member.param: The link portion of the address, which can be relative.
The code base portion of the address.
The application portion of the address.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS
member.summary: Specifies how a URL is converted to canonical form.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_UNESCAPE
member.summary: Unescape any escape sequences that the URLs contain, with two exceptions. The escape sequences for ? and # characters are not unescaped. If one of the URL_ESCAPE flags is also set, the two URLs are unescaped, combined, and then escaped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_ESCAPE_UNSAFE
member.summary: Replace unsafe characters with their escape sequences. Unsafe characters are characters that may be altered during transport across the Internet, and include the <, >, ", #, {, }, |, \, ^, [, ], and ' characters. This flag applies to all URLs, including opaque URLs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_PLUGGABLE_PROTOCOL
member.summary: Combine URLs with client-defined pluggable protocols, according to the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification. This flag does not apply to standard protocols such as ftp, http, gopher, and so on.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_WININET_COMPATIBILITY
member.summary: Merge all the parameters to create a full URL

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_DONT_ESCAPE_EXTRA_INFO
member.summary: Used only in conjunction with URL_ESCAPE_SPACES_ONLY to prevent the conversion of characters in the query (the portion of the URL following the first # or ? character encountered in the string). This flag should not be used alone or combined with URL_ESCAPE_SEGMENT_ONLY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_DONT_UNESCAPE_EXTRA_INFO
member.summary: Used only in conjunction with URL_ESCAPE_SPACES_ONLY to prevent the conversion of characters in the query (the portion of the URL following the first # or ? character encountered in the string). This flag should not be used alone or combined with URL_ESCAPE_SEGMENT_ONLY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_BROWSER_MODE
member.summary: Defined to be the same as URL_DONT_ESCAPE_EXTRA_INFO.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_ESCAPE_SPACES_ONLY
member.summary: Replace only spaces with escape sequences. This flag takes precedence over URL_ESCAPE_UNSAFE, but does not apply to opaque URLs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_DONT_SIMPLIFY
member.summary: Treat /./ and /../ in a URL string as literal characters, and not as shorthand for navigation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_NO_META
member.summary: Defined to be the same as URL_DONT_SIMPLIFY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_UNESCAPE_INPLACE
member.summary: Convert escape sequences back into ordinary characters and overwrite the original string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_CONVERT_IF_DOSPATH
member.summary: Convert to a URL if in a dospath format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_UNESCAPE_HIGH_ANSI_ONLY
member.summary: Unescape only high ANSI escape characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_INTERNAL_PATH
member.summary: Escape # characters found in paths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_FILE_USE_PATHURL
member.summary: Use DOS path compatibility mode to create "file" Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs).

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_ESCAPE_PERCENT
member.summary: Convert any occurrence of "%" to its escape sequence.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS.URL_ESCAPE_SEGMENT_ONLY
member.summary: Indication that the URL contains only the section following the server component but preceding the query. All unsafe characters in the string are converted. If a full URL is provided when this flag is set, all unsafe characters in the entire string are converted, including # and ? characters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_IS
member.summary: Identifies the type of URL that the unmanaged UrlIs function will test for.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_IS.URLIS_URL
member.summary: The URL is valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_IS.URLIS_OPAQUE
member.summary: The URL is opaque, which means that it has a scheme that is not followed by two forward slashes (//).

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_IS.URLIS_NOHISTORY
member.summary: The URL is a no-history URL, which is a URL that browsers typically do not include in their navigation history.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_IS.URLIS_FILEURL
member.summary: The URL is a file URL, which takes the form file://host/path.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_IS.URLIS_APPLIABLE
member.summary: The UrlIs function will attempt to determine a valid scheme for the URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_IS.URLIS_DIRECTORY
member.summary: The URL string ends with a directory name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_IS.URLIS_HASQUERY
member.summary: The URL has an appended query string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_PART
member.summary: Identifies the parts of a URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_PART.NONE
member.summary: No part of the URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_PART.SCHEME
member.summary: The URL scheme.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_PART.HOSTNAME
member.summary: The host name part of the URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_PART.USERNAME
member.summary: The user name part of the URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_PART.PASSWORD
member.summary: The password part of the URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_PART.PORT
member.summary: The port number part of the URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_PART.QUERY
member.summary: The query string part of the URL.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory
member.summary: Provides methods for creating secure class factories.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.CORIESECURITY_SITE
member.summary: Specifies the value 0x02.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.CORIESECURITY_ZONE
member.summary: Specifies the value 0x01.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.CreateInstanceWithSecurity(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a COM type that represents a secure class factory.
member.returns: An object that is a wrapper for the new instance. The return value must be unwrapped to access the real object.
member.param: One of the following CORIESECURITY values: CORIESECURITY_ZONE: 0x01 CORIESECURITY_SITE: 0x02
One of the following URLZONE values: URLZONE_LOCAL_MACHINE: 0x00 URLZONE_INTRANET: 0x01 URLZONE_TRUSTED: 0x02 URLZONE_INTERNET: 0x03 URLZONE_UNTRUSTED: 0x04
The URL for the site that contains the application for which the secure class factory will be created.
The unique identity for the site.
The link portion of the URL, which can be relative.
The location of the license files to associate with the domain.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.RemoteCreateInstance(System.Guid,System.Object@)
member.summary: Not implemented.
member.param: Not used.
Always null when this method returns.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.RemoteLockServer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Not implemented.
member.param: Not used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.WININET_CACHE_ENTRY
member.summary: Contains information about an entry in the Internet cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.WININET_CACHE_ENTRY.NORMAL_CACHE_ENTRY
member.summary: Normal cache entry; can be deleted to recover space for new entries.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.WININET_CACHE_ENTRY.COOKIE_CACHE_ENTRY
member.summary: Cookie cache entry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.WININET_CACHE_ENTRY.URLHISTORY_CACHE_ENTRY
member.summary: Visited link cache entry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.WININET_CACHE_ENTRY.TRACK_OFFLINE_CACHE_ENTRY
member.summary: Not currently implemented.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.WININET_CACHE_ENTRY.TRACK_ONLINE_CACHE_ENTRY
member.summary: Not currently implemented.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.WININET_CACHE_ENTRY.STICKY_CACHE_ENTRY
member.summary: Sticky cache entry that is exempt from scavenging. The default value set by CommitUrlCacheEntry is one day.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.WININET_CACHE_ENTRY.SPARSE_CACHE_ENTRY
member.summary: Partial response cache entry.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.SecureFactory.CreateInstanceWithSecurity2(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a COM type that represents a secure class factory by using information from the deployment manifest.
member.returns: An object that is a wrapper for the new instance. The return value must be unwrapped to access the real object.
member.param: One of the following CORIESECURITY values: CORIESECURITY_ZONE: 0x01 CORIESECURITY_SITE: 0x02
One of the following URLZONE values: URLZONE_LOCAL_MACHINE: 0x00 URLZONE_INTRANET: 0x01 URLZONE_TRUSTED: 0x02 URLZONE_INTERNET: 0x03 URLZONE_UNTRUSTED: 0x04
The URL for the site that contains the application for which the secure class factory will be created.
The unique identity for the site.
The link portion of the URL, which can be relative.
The location of the license files to associate with the domain.
The location of the deployment manifest.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IE.Manager.GetSecuredClassFactory(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a class factory that provides security information about the assembly and the name of the type.
member.returns: An object that represents the secure class factory.
member.param: One of the following CORIESECURITY values: CORIESECURITY_ZONE: 0x01 CORIESECURITY_SITE: 0x02
One of the following URLZONE values: URLZONE_LOCAL_MACHINE: 0x00 URLZONE_INTRANET: 0x01 URLZONE_TRUSTED: 0x02 URLZONE_INTERNET: 0x03 URLZONE_UNTRUSTED: 0x04
The site address.

The name of the type.
